title: Zac
body: why was zac reworked? I used to like that champ :(

replies.body: they wanted him to feel more satisfying to play beyond hitting an e. Unfortunately they thought adding more cc and whole team displacement would increase that satisfaction. When it inevitably proved how strong having 3/4 of your abilities be hard cc in pro play, they nerfed him hard.

Because his entire kit revolved around being close to your enemy instead of actually trying to be strategic and position? I can’t speak for game health, but I felt like old Zac was just poorly designed. There was next to no skill involved beyond his E. I’m not saying that they did everything right by piling on CC and then nerfing him into obscurity, but they did good in giving him more skill expression. You’re right that there are huge problems now, but don’t act like there weren’t before.

If a champion only has one ability going for them, that’s not a good sign. Outside of his E, there was literally no skill involved. It was nearly impossible to miss your Q and the only way you were going to waste your ult was if they used a mobility spell or if you accidentally hit the R button. All you had to do was chase them. Now you actually have to work for it instead of mindlessly spamming abilities.

It was nearly impossible to miss your Q and the only way you were going to waste your ult was if they used a mobility spell or if you accidentally hit the R button. All you had to do was chase them. Now you actually have to work for it instead of mindlessly spamming abilities.

I don't think having just one good ability is necessarily problematic. Zac's E was, and still is, enough fun to carry the whole kit.

Landing old R on one person in a gank was not hard. Knocking back the right enemies at the right time, maximizing damage with it, and optimizing the number of blobs you pick up for survival during a team fight was much more nuanced. It required significantly more skill expression to ult well than any of the 80 fire-and-forget single button press out there.
